page.title: 17RELIGIOUS MEETING PLACES
page.content: The Sunken Church was most probably the first church in Bramcote. It was built on a hill at the top of Cow Lane in the 13th/14th century.Since the church was small, a new one was built. The Nave and Chancel were pulled down in 1862 leaving only the Tower. St. Michael's Church of England was built in 1861 on land given by John Sherwin Gregory. The bells and old font from the sunken church were put into the new church. The Methodist chapel and St. Gregory's Catholic Church Hall are relatively new buildings.
